data.text: At the same time, saith the Lord,
Thus saith the Lord,
The Lord hath appeared of old unto me, saying,
Again I will build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of Israel:
Thou shalt yet plant vines upon the mountains of Samaria:
For there shall be a day,
For thus saith the Lord;
Behold, I will bring them from the north country,
They shall come with weeping,
Hear the word of the Lord, O ye nations,
For the Lord hath redeemed Jacob,
Therefore they shall come and sing in the height of Zion,
Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance,
And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness,
Thus saith the Lord;
Thus saith the Lord,
And there is hope in thine end, saith the Lord,
I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning himself thus;
Surely after that I was turned, I repented;
Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a pleasant child?
Set thee up waymarks, make thee high heaps:
How long wilt thou go about, O thou backsliding daughter?
Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel;
And there shall dwell in Judah itself,
For I have satiated the weary soul,
Upon this I awaked, and beheld;
Behold, the days come, saith the Lord,
And it shall come to pass, that like as I have watched over them,
In those days they shall say no more,
But every one shall die for his own iniquity:
Behold, the days come, saith the Lord,
Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers
But this shall be the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel;
And they shall teach no more every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying,
Thus saith the Lord, which giveth the sun for a light by day,
If those ordinances depart from before me, saith the Lord,
Thus saith the Lord;
Behold, the days come, saith the Lord,
And the measuring line shall yet go forth over against it
And the whole valley of the dead bodies, and of the ashes,
